title: RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Overview > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Overview
RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork (TBF) Sensor Module Overview
content: RAK12031 is a WisBlock T-Beam-Fork (TBF) sensor module that is based on EE-SX1041 from Omron. It can detect the presence of small moving objects, measure the speed of rotation, linear motion, and more. RAK12031 is a separate TBF sensor and have two (2) connectors, which can be connected to the [RAK12028 TBF Connector module](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12028/overview/) or by using a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension
parent_content: RAK12031 is a WisBlock T-Beam-Fork (TBF) sensor module that is based on EE-SX1041 from Omron. It can detect the presence of small moving objects, measure the speed of rotation, linear motion, and more. RAK12031 is a separate TBF sensor and have two (2) connectors, which can be connected to the [RAK12028 TBF Connector module](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12028/overview/) or by using a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension Cable](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak19005/overview/) to connect it to the WisBlock Base.

title: RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork (TBF) Sensor Module Overview
content: or by using a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension Cable](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak19005/overview/) to connect it to the WisBlock Base.
parent_content: RAK12031 is a WisBlock T-Beam-Fork (TBF) sensor module that is based on EE-SX1041 from Omron. It can detect the presence of small moving objects, measure the speed of rotation, linear motion, and more. RAK12031 is a separate TBF sensor and have two (2) connectors, which can be connected to the [RAK12028 TBF Connector module](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12028/overview/) or by using a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension Cable](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak19005/overview/) to connect it to the WisBlock Base.

title: RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Mounting > RAK12031 Mounting and Connection Options
content: The RAK12031 has four (4) mounting holes, so you can fix the module in the position you want. It can also be connected to [RAK12028](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12028/overview/#product-description) or you can use a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension Cable (optional)](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/fpc-extension-cable-for-slot-a-to-d-rak19005) to connect it directly to the WisBlock Base.
parent_content: The RAK12031 has four (4) mounting holes, so you can fix the module in the position you want. It can also be connected to [RAK12028](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12028/overview/#product-description) or you can use a [RAK19005 WisBlock Sensor Extension Cable (optional)](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/fpc-extension-cable-for-slot-a-to-d-rak19005) to connect it directly to the WisBlock Base.

title: RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Chipset > Vendor and Part Number Information [TABLE]

RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK12031 Module Connectors and Pinout [TABLE]
content:
The RAK12031 module has two (2) connectors, one standard 24-pin WisBlock Sensor connector and the other one is the 6-pin connector that can be connected to the RAK12028. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 2**.  
> **Image:** RAK12031 pinout  
If a 24-pin WisBlock Sensor connector is used, the IO used for the output pulse depends on what slot the module is plugged in. The following table shows the default IO used for different slots:
parent_content:
The RAK12031 module has two (2) connectors, one standard 24-pin WisBlock Sensor connector and the other one is the 6-pin connector that can be connected to the RAK12028. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 2**.  
> **Image:** RAK12031 pinout  
If a 24-pin WisBlock Sensor connector is used, the IO used for the output pulse depends on what slot the module is plugged in. The following table shows the default IO used for different slots:  
| SLOT A | SLOT C | SLOT D | SLOT E | SLOT F |
| :----: | :----: | :----: | :----: | :----: |
| WB_IO1 | WB_IO3 | WB_IO5 | WB_IO4 | WB_IO6 |  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- Only **3V3_S**, **GND**, and **OUTPUT** signal from EE-SX1041 are connected to the two (2) connectors of the module.
- **3V3_S** voltage output from the WisBlock Base that powers the RAK12031 module can be controlled by the WisBlock Core via WB_IO2 (WisBlock IO2 pin). This makes the module ideal for low-power IoT projects since the WisBlock Core can totally disconnect the power of the RAK12031 module.

content:

| WB_IO1 | WB_IO3 | WB_IO5 | WB_IO4 | WB_IO6 |  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- Only **3V3_S**, **GND**, and **OUTPUT** signal from EE-SX1041 are connected to the two (2) connectors of the module.

title: RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12031 WisBlock T-Beam-Fork Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > EE-SX1041 > Current-Limiting Resistor Values for RAK12031 [TABLE]
content:
- **R1** is the current-limiting resistance at the Transmitter (Tx). The value of **R1** is 68Ω.
- **R2** is the current-limiting resistance at the Receiver (Rx). The value or **R2** is 1kΩ.  
> **Image:** EE-SX1041
parent_content:
- **R1** is the current-limiting resistance at the Transmitter (Tx). The value of **R1** is 68Ω.
- **R2** is the current-limiting resistance at the Receiver (Rx). The value or **R2** is 1kΩ.  
> **Image:** EE-SX1041
